gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 4,43]]At that time Jesus left [Samaria] for Galilee.
[[Jn 4,44]]For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his native place.
[[Jn 4,45]]When he came into Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, since they had seen all he had done in Jerusalem at the feast; for they themselves had gone to the feast.
[[Jn 4,46]]Then he returned to Cana in Galilee, where he had made the water wine. Now there was a royal official whose son was ill in Capernaum.
[[Jn 4,47]]When he heard that Jesus had arrived in Galilee from Judea, he went to him and asked him to come down and heal his son, who was near death.
[[Jn 4,48]]Jesus said to him, "Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will not believe."
[[Jn 4,49]]The royal official said to him, "Sir, come down before my child dies."
[[Jn 4,50]]Jesus said to him, "You may go; your son will live." The man believed what Jesus said to him and left.
[[Jn 4,51]]While he was on his way back, his slaves met him and told him that his boy would live.
[[Jn 4,52]]He asked them when he began to recover. They told him, "The fever left him yesterday, about one in the afternoon."
[[Jn 4,53]]The father realized that just at that time Jesus had said to him, "Your son will live," and he and his whole household came to believe.
[[Jn 4,54]](Now) this was the second sign Jesus did when he came to Galilee from Judea.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 30,2]]I will extol you, O LORD, for you drew me clear 
and did not let my enemies rejoice over me.
[[Ps 30,4]]O LORD, you brought me up from the nether world; 
you preserved me from among those going down into the pit.

[[Ps 30,5]]Sing praise to the LORD, you his faithful ones, 
and give thanks to his holy name.
[[Ps 30,6]]For his anger lasts but a moment; 
a lifetime, his good will.
[[Ps 30,11]]At nightfall, weeping enters in, 
but with the dawn, rejoicing.

[[Ps 30,12a]]Hear, O LORD, and have pity on me; 
O LORD, be my helper.‚Äù
[[Ps 30,13b]]You changed my mourning into dancing;
O LORD, my God, forever will I give you thanks.
